alert.note: Alert for Hutchinson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:56PM CDT until June 17 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN LIPSCOMB...WHEELER...EASTERN CARSON...SOUTHEASTERN HUTCHINSON...GRAY...ROBERTS...HEMPHILL AND SOUTHEASTERN OCHILTREE COUNTIES... At 856 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Lipscomb to 4 miles northwest of Kingsmill, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Lipscomb, Canadian, Shamrock, Miami, Briscoe, Wheeler, White Deer, Mclean, Groom, Lefors, Skellytown, Higgins, Wolf Creek Park, Lake Mcclellan, Twitty, Lake Marvin, Kingsmill, Alanreed and Codman. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
